      • DataSources.DataSourceEntry

        public DataSources.DataSourceEntry(java.lang.Class supportedType,
                           java.lang.Class dataSourceType)
        Create new instance of DataSourceEntry.
        Parameters:
        supportedType - class of object that can be handled by this data source.
        dataSourceType - an implementation of DataSource that will be created by this entry.

    • Method Detail

      • getSupportedType

        public java.lang.Class getSupportedType()
        Get the supported value type (in Class) that is supported by this DataSource.
        Returns:
        a Class that represent the type of value that can be handled by this DataSource.

      • getDataSourceType

        public java.lang.Class getDataSourceType()
        Get the DataSource that will be created if a matching value was found.
        Returns:
        a Class that should be an implementation of DataSource.

      • support

        public boolean support(java.lang.Object object)
        Determine if the DataSource can be used for this object. An object is considered as supported if it is an instance of supportedType or an instance of subclass of supportedType.
        Parameters:
        object - the object that contains value.
        Returns:
        true if this object can be used as value source for DataSource.

      • create

        public DataSource create(java.lang.Object object)
        Create a new instance of DataSource from an object.
        Parameters:
        object - the object that contains value.
        Returns:
        an instance of dataSourceType constructed from object.
